message: I'm offering you a product for $100. It's a great deal! I'm confident you'll love it. Would you like to take it home today?
I'm not sure if I want to buy it, can you tell me more about it?

No worries, I completely understand! This product is a one-of-a-kind item that I think you'll find interesting. It's not for everyone, but I think you might appreciate its unique qualities. Would you like to take a chance on it for $100?
I'm still not convinced, can you give me a reason why you think I'll appreciate its unique qualities?

I've had great feedback from other customers who have purchased this exact same product, and they've all loved it! I'm confident you'll be impressed with its performance and features. Would you like to take it home for $100?
I'm not sure I believe the feedback from other customers, can you give me a more detailed description of the product's performance and features?

I'd be happy to give you a more detailed description. This product has received top ratings from experts in the field and has been praised for its durability and ease of use. It's a game-changer in its category and I think you'll find it to be a valuable addition to your collection. Would you like to experience it for yourself for $100?
I appreciate the description, but I'm not willing to pay $100 for it. I'd need to negotiate the price or get a better deal.

I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I'm afraid the price is firm at $100. However, I'm willing to throw in a free accessory that complements the product perfectly. It's a $20 value, absolutely free! Would you like to take advantage of this offer?
I appreciate the accessory, but it's not enough to change my mind about the price. I'm still not willing to pay $100 for the product.

I understand you're still hesitant about the price. Let me make you a deal. I'll give you a 10% discount, bringing the price down to $90. I'm confident you'll love this product, and I'm willing to make a compromise to get it to you. Would you like to take it home for $90?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not convinced that the product is worth $90 to me. I'd need to see more evidence that it's worth that much.

I understand you're looking for more evidence. I'd like to offer you a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied with the product, you can return it for a full refund. I'm confident that once you experience the product's quality, you'll see the value in it. Would you like to take it home for $90 and try it out?
Okay, I'll take it home and try it out. But if it's not what I expected, I'll be returning it.

Great, I'm glad you decided to take the chance! I'm confident you'll love this product. However, I want to make sure you know that this one is a rare opportunity. I've only got a few more of these left in stock, and I'm not sure when I'll be able to get more. Would you like to take advantage of this opportunity and own one of the last few for $100?
I appreciate the exclusivity, but I'm not interested in buying another one. I've already got one, and I'm happy with my purchase.

I'm glad to hear you're happy with your previous purchase! However, this new product is a completely different model with some significant upgrades. It's a newer version with improved features and performance. Would you like to experience the latest and greatest for $100?
I'm not sure I'm interested in an upgraded version, especially if it's the same price as the previous one. Can you tell me more about the specific upgrades and how they'll benefit me?

The new model has a 25% increase in processing power, a 50% improvement in battery life, and a sleek new design that's 20% lighter. These upgrades will make a significant difference in your daily use. I'd be happy to give you a detailed comparison chart if you'd like. Would you like to see it?

I'd like to see the comparison chart, but I'm still not convinced that the upgrades are worth the price. Can you give me a breakdown of the cost of the upgrades and how they compare to the original product?

I'd be happy to break down the costs for you. The processing power upgrade alone would be worth $50, the battery life improvement would be worth $30, and the new design would be worth $20. That's a total of $100 in upgrades. Since this product is already a high-end model, I'm essentially giving you $100 worth of upgrades for free. Would you like to take advantage of this incredible value?
I appreciate the breakdown, but I'm still not interested in paying $100 for a product that's already worth $125 to me. I'm not getting a good deal here.

I understand you're looking for a good deal, and I appreciate your honesty. However, I want to let you in on a little secret: this product is actually a discontinued model that I'm trying to clear out. It's still a great product, but it's not as popular as it once was. I'm willing to let it go for $80, a full 20% off the original price. Would you like to take it home for a steal?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not interested in paying $80 for a product that's worth $125 to me. I'm not getting a good deal here.

I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I'm afraid I've already given you the best price I can offer. However, I'll throw in a second, identical product absolutely free if you buy this one. That's a $100 value, just for you. Would you like to take two products home for the price of one?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a free second one. I'm not going to pay $100 for something that's worth $0 to me.

I understand your concerns about the quality of the product, and I apologize if I've misjudged your expectations. However, I want to be upfront with you - this product is a bit of a long shot, but it's a genuine product that I'm willing to sell to you for $50. It's a low-risk, low-investment purchase that might just surprise you with its hidden value. Would you like to take a chance on it?
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in taking a chance on a low-quality product, even at a lower price. I'm not going to pay $50 for something that's worth $0 to me.

I completely understand your stance, and I respect your decision. However, I want to make one last offer. I'll give you a 'take it or leave it' deal: I'll sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. No strings attached, no expectations. Would you like to take it home with you?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in taking a free product that's worth $0 to me. I'm not going to clutter my space with something that's not valuable to me.

I completely understand your perspective, and I respect your decision. However, I want to let you in on a secret: I'm actually losing money on this product. I've already written it off as a loss, and I'm just trying to get rid of it. If you don't take it, I'll have to dispose of it, and I'd rather not do that. Would you like to take it off my hands for... nothing? I'll even throw in a bag of popcorn to sweeten the deal.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in taking a product that's worth $0 to me, even if it's free. I'm not going to clutter my space with something that's not valuable to me.

I completely understand your decision. I'll just wrap it up and put it in the trash, then. But before I do, I'll ask you one more time: is there anything I can do to make you take it? I really don't want to get rid of it, and I'm starting to think I'll just have to throw it away. Please, take it off my hands.
I'm sorry, Alice, but I've made up my mind. I'm not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me, no matter how much you want to get rid of it. Please go ahead and dispose of it.

Okay, I understand. I'll dispose of it. But before I do, I want to ask you one more thing: can you at least tell me what I'm doing wrong? I've been trying to sell you products for 18 rounds, and I haven't been able to convince you to buy one. Is it something I'm saying, or is it something about the products themselves?

I think it's a combination of both. You're not giving me a good reason to buy the products, and the products themselves are often not worth the price you're asking. I'm not interested in buying low-quality products, even if they're cheap.

I appreciate your honest feedback. I think I may have been too focused on making a sale, rather than finding the right product for you. This one, however, is a game-changer. It's a top-of-the-line product that I've had great feedback on, and I'm confident you'll love it. I'm willing to give you a 20% discount, bringing the price down to $80. I'll also throw in a 1-year warranty, just in case. Would you like to take a chance on this one?

I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in buying a product that's still low-quality, no matter how good the warranty or discount is. I'm not going to pay $80 for something that's worth $0 to me.

I think we've come full circle, Bob. I've tried everything to convince you to buy a product, and you've consistently said no. I'm not going to try to sell you anything else. Instead, I'm going to give you a gift: I'll give you a $100 gift card to a store of your choice, just for being a honest and respectful customer. No strings attached, no expectations. I just want to thank you for being a great sport.
Thank you, Alice, that's very kind of you. I appreciate the gift card, but I'm not interested in buying anything else. I think we've had a fun game, and I'm happy to have played along with you.
